links.title: Maximization (psychology) - Wikipedia
links.description: Maximization is a style of decision-making characterized by seeking the best option through an exhaustive search through alternatives. It is contrasted with satisficing, in which individuals evaluate options until they find one that is "good enough".

links.title: Satisficing - Wikipedia
